metadata.Title: CVE-2012-5112 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the SVG implementation in WebKit, as used in Google Chrome before 22.0.1229.94, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5112` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 22.0.1229.94~r161065-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 22.0.1229.94~r161065-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 22.0.1229.94~r161065-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 22.0.1229.94~r161065-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 22.0.1229.94~r161065-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.9-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> r161037 (BUG=154983) does not affect webkit in Ubuntu https://trac.webkit.org/changeset/130855 may be the fix, but the upstream chromium bug is still private

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '22.0.1229.94~r161065-0ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkitgtk package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.9-2ubuntu2').
